channel.title: Xampp/security
channel.description:
Hello,
On xampp, when i try and go onto: http://localhost/security, i get:
[code]Access forbidden!
You don't have permission to access the requested object. It is either read-protected or not readable by the server.
If you think this is a server error, please contact the webmaster. [/code]
does anyone know what i can do?
Thanks

item.title: Xampp/security
item.dc:creator: @nG_Krypton nG Krypton
item.description:
@nG_Krypton wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:5, topic:266210”]please dont get a windows vps, and then run xampp on it.

i recommend centos 5 for servers, its fairly trivial to use yum to install lighttpd (or apache, if you’re a gay), php, some sql server, whatever.[/quote]

Or alternatively if your host allows usage of Lxadmin, just use that. Most (Including my VPS) are default to install a Centos 5 Host in a box, which defaults to lighttpd with all the configurations and ability to use php, mysql(lite?) etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Xampp/security
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

try 127.0.0.1/security

if that doesn’t work, get a real server.

Read full topic
